text:
Everyone knew when Marfa Petrovna would read the letter, and people showed up to hear it, even if they’d heard it before. Honestly, a lot of that was unnecessary, but that’s just how Marfa is. She managed to clear Dounia’s name, while the whole mess fell squarely on her husband’s shoulders. I started to feel a bit sorry for him—it was a bit harsh.

Dounia got offers to give lessons in several families, but she turned them down. Suddenly, everyone treated her with respect, which set off a chain of events that changed our lives. 

You should know, dear Rodya, that Dounia has a suitor, and she’s agreed to marry him. I’m telling you this even though it happened without your say-so. I hope you won’t be upset with us; we couldn’t wait for your input since you weren’t here to see everything unfold. 

So, here’s the scoop: His name is Pyotr Petrovitch Luzhin, and he’s a counselor (that’s a good job). He’s also related to Marfa Petrovna, who helped make this happen. It all started when he expressed interest through her. He came over, had coffee with us, and...

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marfa Petrovna successfully restored Dounia's reputation, leading to her engagement to Pyotr Petrovitch Luzhin.
